text: Your list is amazing Supra. I've been listening since around the 70th one, and not only does it supply us with great music, but it also brings games that we might've passed over, or never even heard of to the forefront. Thank you for helping my collection and experience grow as a whole!
author: mikeal123456789

text:
People need to realize the difference between the production team and the development team The developers design the game, producers have some input on game contents and control the release of the finished product along with localization and choosing whether to prevent people from having multiple saves
The games capcom develops are (generally) good but capcom themselves suck giant donkey balls in hopes its a magic money donkey so it will cum quarters on them and they will be as rich as nintendo.
author: bulbinking

text: I agree that nowadays they're greedy and only make games for casual gamers, but I'm saying that even if they had a good idea all of their haters wouldn't admit it because they feel that Capcom "deserves to be hated" or something. That, or they're just stubborn.
author: TargetHippo

text: I think it is foolish and immature to expect a company to not try to make as much money as they can from their good work. Capcom sees in this port an opportunity to make more money by doing something fans asked, not by ripping them off. I also do not believe that them porting games is a new thing. There were many ports of Street Fighter II and Ghouls'n Ghosts, for instance.
author: Shad G

text: No, the majority of fans don't WANT to hate a company who's goal is releasing entertainment, but it's clear the glory days of Capcom are long gone.
author: Ragitsu

text:
They're pleasing their fans in part because of the massive backlash of negativity concerning Resident Evil 6.

As for profit? Hey, companies have to stay afloat, but it's clear this has surpassed their goal of pleasing fans of the series. Capcom did not used to operate in this manner.
author: Ragitsu

text: Even if I do dislike the current Capcom I would have to agree with you. I think that people just WANT a reason to hate the company.
author: TargetHippo

text: I do not understand how a video game company wanting to make more money from their games while pleasing the fans that were asking for a console version is bad in any way.
author: Shad G

text: It is a cheap way to double dip on sales more than a year later: why didn't they release it back in early 2012? Hm...
author: Ragitsu

text: I don't see how pointing out that porting RE:Revelations to other consoles is a good idea makes me a Capcom defender.

text: There is no reasoning with people like you, is there?

author: heyjeySigma

text:
Don't be a Capcom defender.

To those who downvoted my original comment, shame on you: the company IS a shadow of it's former self. They turned Resident Evil into a Michael Bay-esque action series, drove Mega Man into the ground, and shamelessly milk Street Fighter.
author: Ragitsu

text: Surely I cannot be the only one thinking that Capcom bringing a great game to a wider audience after fans complained that it was "only a 3DS game" is not only a sound business move, but also a good way to please fans of the Resident Evil series.

author: Shad G

text:
Congrats on 1,500 videos.
I've heard this game is a gem. While I don't agree that Resident Evil has gone down the shitter as much as people claim it has, it's nice to see games on which everybody can agree.
author: Shad G

text: Playing this game since yesterday, I've been really blown away by its presentation. Awesome graphics, great sound, solid writing, it doesn't feel like a "RE Light" just because it's on a handheld. It's coming to consoles pretty soon as well, but I'm really enjoying the portable horror experience. The whole ship level is actually creepy, I missed that from this franchise. I just beat the "Mayday" boss, I had a hard time with it but it's all fun. This track could be straight from a Castlevania.
author: SupraDarky
